bibl.title: Letter from Jessie Daniel Ames to Pedro Nogueira, November 13, 1952

div1.p: Jessie Ames writes that she is planning to attend the dedication ceremony at Camp Lazear. She provides Nogueira with a list of names of her three children so that they can receive invitations for the event.

div1.head: Letter from Jessie Daniel Ames to Pedro Nogueira, November 13, 1952
div1.p:
Dr. Philip Hench has asked me to send you the addresses
of members of the family of Dr. Roger Post Ames, so
that you cand them invitations to the ceremony of de-
dication of the tablets erected in honor of those who par-
ticipated in the Yellow Fever Experiments at Camp Lazear.

Besides myself, his widow, there are three children. The
names and addresses are:
Frederick D. Ames, M.D.
2418 Travis Street
Houston, Texas
Mary D. Ames, M.D.
2039 North Second Street
Harrisburg, Pennsylvania
Miss Lulu Daniel Ames,
206 East Tenth Street
Austin, Texas.

I am planning to be present, and am looking forward to
receiving the invitation which, I gather from Dr. Hench
will be sent me at my home here.
